type.context: PUBLIC HOLIDAYS ACT under What is a public holiday. 2. In this Act public holiday means a day which (subject to the provisions of section 4) is dies non, and which is kept as a holiday by all banks, educational establishments, public offices and government departments.

type.title: Public holidays.
type.context: PUBLIC HOLIDAYS ACT under Public holidays. 3. (1) The following days shall be public holidays namely  every Sunday; the first week-day of January; Republic Day, that is to say such day in each year as shall, by notice LAWS OF GUYANA 4 19:07 Public Holidays  L.R.O. 1/2012                                Exclusion of certain offices, or departments.   Acts relating to negotiable instruments.  c. 90:13      Appointment of holidays by the Minister.  published in the Gazette, be appointed for the purpose by the Minister responsible for public holidays; Good Friday; Easter Monday; Labour Day, that is to say, the 1st May, or, if that day is a Sunday, the following day;  Commonwealth Day, that is to say the first Monday in August; Christmas Day, or, if that day is a Sunday, the following day; the 26th December, or if that day is a Sunday, the following day, unless Christmas  Day falls on a Sunday,  and then the Tuesday following Christmas Day;  Phagwah Day, or, if that day is a Sunday, the following day; Deepavali Day, or, if that day is a Sunday, the following day; Eid-Ul-Azha Day, or, if that day is a Sunday, the following day; Youman Nabi Day, or, if that day is a Sunday, the following day.  (2) During every year, the Minister responsible for public holidays shall cause notices of the days constituted  public holidays in respect of that years Phagwah, Deepavali, Eid-Ul-Azha and Youman Nabi by subsection (1) to be published in the Gazette as soon as reasonably practicable before the dates so notified, respectively.

type.name: section
type.title: Acts relating to negotiable instruments.
type.context: PUBLIC HOLIDAYS ACT under Acts relating to negotiable instruments. 5. Subject to the Bills of Exchange Act, it is not necessary for anyone to make any payment or to do any other act, including noting or protesting, relating  to any negotiable  instrument  on a public holiday, but all obligation  to make  that payment  or to do that other act shall apply to the next following day not being itself a public holiday.
